snippet: Some have questioned whether the gambling industry’s support for the Committee to Save New York, a lobbying group that backed Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, influenced his plan to expand casino gambling.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo defends his ties to private lobbying group Committee to Save New York, which has received $2 million from the gambling industry, asserting that his support of casino gambling expansion in New York State is about job creation; says he does not believe it is his place to call on the group to release its donor list voluntarily and that he will not urge them to do so.
lead_paragraph: Some have questioned whether the gambling industry’s support for the Committee to Save New York, a lobbying group that backed Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, influenced his plan to expand casino gambling.

headline.seo: Cuomo Defends Ties to Ally Backed by Gambling Group
headline.main: Cuomo Defends Ties to Ally Backed by Gambling Group
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Defends Ties to Ally Backed by Gambling Group
